content: quote: CARACAS (Reuters) - Venezuela's President Hugo Chavez said on Sunday his U.S. counterpart Barack Obama was at best an "ignoramus" for saying the socialist leader exported terrorism and obstructed progress in Latin America. "He goes and accuses me of exporting terrorism: the least I can say is that he's a poor ignoramus; he should read and study a little to understand reality," said Chavez, who heads a group of left-wing Latin American leaders opposed to the U.S. influence in the region. Chavez said Obama's comments had made him change his mind about sending a new ambassador to Washington, after he withdrew the previous envoy in a dispute last year with the Bush administration in which he also expelled the U.S. ambassador to Venezuela. <more> "http://www.reuters.com/article/topNews/idUSTRE52L19G20090322" I'd simply note that these verbal confrontations are, IMHO, unnecessary. POTUS 43 unnecessarily poisoned the diplomatic well with his "Axis of Evil" ... and it appears that POTUS 44 has taken the same path. Adversarial "diplomacy" via media interviews or SOTU speeches is no diplomacy at all.
quote: CARACAS (Reuters) - Venezuela's President Hugo Chavez said on Sunday his U.S. counterpart Barack Obama was at best an "ignoramus" for saying the socialist leader exported terrorism and obstructed progress in Latin America. Chavez said Obama's comments had made him change his mind about sending a new ambassador to Washington, after he withdrew the previous envoy in a dispute last year with the Bush administration in which he also expelled the U.S. ambassador to Venezuela. <more> "http://www.reuters.com/article/topNews/idUSTRE52L19G20090322"

title: Venezuela's Chavez Labels POTUS 44 an "Ignoramus"

title: Venezuela's Chavez Labels POTUS 44 an "Ignoramus"

content: Speaking of Hugo, I noticed this morning that the Weather Channel is not only running ads from CITGO, but displaying their corporate logo during the local weather segment. I complained to them and vowed not to watch their channel until they remove it and tell Hugo where to stick his ad money. He's made a habit of speaking rudely about our Presidents and working against our interests, so I see no reason to patronize a business which takes money from him. Do you?
reply: Speaking of Hugo, I noticed this morning that the Weather Channel is not only running ads from CITGO, but displaying their corporate logo during the local weather segment.
